author: ddam
msg: fix lookup of DirObjectFactory by running Spring LDAP searches inside the context of Jetspeed's classloader instead of the calling webapp's classloader (e.g. a portlet app). The Java LDAP implementation maintains a cached list of DirObjectFactory objects per classloader (i.e. the current thread's classloader). This means that a lookup in this cache fails when called from a different classloader.

author: chirino
msg: Applying AMQ-1957.. Thanks for the patch.

author: ddam
msg: revert changes; use Spring LDAP's AbstractContextMapper as base class
